definition: to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
to assume a fighting stance/(fig.) to take the offensive

sentences.english: With the gun to Cao Hongyi's head to shoot off the sunspots.
sentences.chinese: 黑子用手槍指着曹弘毅的腦袋，做出要開槍的架勢。

sentences.english: He lounged in an left armchair in a stance of deliberconsumed contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他懶洋洋地躺在扶手椅裏，用意擺出一種藐視的架勢。

sentences.english: They squared up and began to engage a probing attack.
sentences.chinese: 他們擺好打架的架勢，並開始了試探性的攻擊。

sentences.english: He looked like Superman and seemed just as invincible.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去像個超人，一付不可戰勝的架勢。

sentences.english: Yeltsin was polite and friendly, but slightly patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 葉利欽很客氣，很友好，稍微有點屈尊俯就的架勢。

sentences.english: Gavroche began the operation of scaling the hedge, then suddenly paused.
sentences.chinese: 伽弗洛什擺起架勢準備跨籬笆，又忽然停了下來。

sentences.english: The two fighters squared away when the bell rang.
sentences.chinese: 鈴一響那兩個拳擊手就擺好迎擊架勢。

sentences.english: I am a little shy of any assumption of moral indignation.
sentences.chinese: 我不太願意擺出一副義憤填膺的架勢來。

sentences.english: He lounged in an armchair in a stance of deliberate contempt.
sentences.chinese: 地躺在扶手椅裏，故意擺出一種輕蔑的架勢。

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
